description: The cumulative total of confirmed Covid-19 cases. Confirmed cases include presumptive positive cases and probable cases, in accordance with CDC guidelines as of April 14.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

description: The cumulative total of deaths from Covid-19. Death totals in the US include confirmed and probable, in accordance with CDC guidelines as of April 14.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

description: The cumulative total of recoveries from Covid-19. Recovered cases outside China are estimates based on local media reports, and state and local reporting when available, and therefore may be substantially lower than the true number.
reference: Dong, E., Du, H., & Gardner, L. (2020). An interactive web-based dashboard to track COVID-19 in real time. The Lancet, 20(5), 533–534. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1473-3099(20)30120-1
notes: China includes Hong Kong; Denmark includes Greenland; France includes overseas territories; Netherlands includes overseas territories; United Kingdom includes overseas territories

description: Total confirmed cases of COVID-19
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

description: New confirmed cases of COVID-19

description: Total tests for COVID-19
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: New tests for COVID-19
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: New tests for COVID-19 (7-day smoothed). For countries that don't report testing data on a daily basis, we assume that testing changed equally on a daily basis over any periods in which no data was reported. This produces a complete series of daily figures, which is then averaged over a rolling 7-day window
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: Total tests for COVID-19 per 1,000 people
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: New tests for COVID-19 per 1,000 people
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: New tests for COVID-19 (7-day smoothed) per 1,000 people
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Units across countries are not consistent (tests performed vs people tested vs samples tested); see owid_tests_units. Data from national government reports.

description: Units used by the location to report its testing data
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from National government reports

description: Government Response Stringency Index: composite measure based on 9 response indicators including school closures, workplace closures, and travel bans, rescaled to a value from 0 to 100 (100 = strictest response)
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker, Blavatnik School of Government

description: Population in 2020
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from United Nations, Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Population Division, World Population Prospects: The 2019 Revision

description: Number of people divided by land area, measured in square kilometers, most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, sourced from Food and Agriculture Organization and World Bank estimates

description: Median age of the population, UN projection for 2020
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from UN Population Division, World Population Prospects, 2017 Revision

description: Share of the population that is 65 years and older, most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, based on age/sex distributions of United Nations Population Division's World Population Prospects: 2017 Revision

description: Share of the population that is 70 years and older in 2015
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from United Nations, Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Population Division (2017), World Population Prospects: The 2017 Revision

description: Gross domestic product at purchasing power parity (constant 2011 international dollars), most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, source from World Bank, International Comparison Program database

description: Share of the population living in extreme poverty, most recent year available since 2010
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, sourced from World Bank Development Research Group

description: Death rate from cardiovascular disease in 2017 (annual number of deaths per 100,000 people)
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from Global Burden of Disease Collaborative Network, Global Burden of Disease Study 2017 Results

description: Diabetes prevalence (% of population aged 20 to 79) in 2017
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, sourced from International Diabetes Federation, Diabetes Atlas

description: Share of women who smoke, most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, sourced from World Health Organization, Global Health Observatory Data Repository

description: Share of men who smoke, most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from World Bank – World Development Indicators, sourced from World Health Organization, Global Health Observatory Data Repository

description: Share of the population with basic handwashing facilities on premises, most recent year available
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from United Nations Statistics Division

description: Hospital beds per 1,000 people, most recent year available since 2010
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from OECD, Eurostat, World Bank, national government records and other sources

description: Life expectancy at birth in 2019
reference: Roser, M., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E., & Hasell, J. (2020). Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19). Our World in Data. https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus
notes: Data from James C. Riley, Clio Infra, United Nations Population Division

description: Record closings of schools and universities
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend closing || 2 - require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools) || 3 - require closing all levels || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record closings of schools and universities
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record closings of workplaces
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend closing (or recommend work from home) || 2 - require closing (or work from home) for some sectors or categories of workers || 3 - require closing (or work from home) for all-but-essential workplaces (eg grocery stores, doctors) || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record closings of workplaces
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record cancelling public events
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend cancelling || 2 - require cancelling || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record cancelling public events
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record limits on private gatherings
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no restrictions || 1 - restrictions on very large gatherings (the limit is above 1000 people) || 2 - restrictions on gatherings between 101-1000 people || 3 - restrictions on gatherings between 11-100 people || 4 - restrictions on gatherings of 10 people or less || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record limits on private gatherings
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record closing of public transport
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend closing (or significantly reduce volume/route/means of transport available) || 2 - require closing (or prohibit most citizens from using it) || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record closing of public transport
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend not leaving house || 2 - require not leaving house with exceptions for daily exercise, grocery shopping, and 'essential' trips || 3 - require not leaving house with minimal exceptions (eg allowed to leave once a week, or only one person can leave at a time, etc) || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record orders to "shelter-in-place" and otherwise confine to the home
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no measures || 1 - recommend not to travel between regions/cities || 2 - internal movement restrictions in place || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record restrictions on internal movement between cities/regions
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record restrictions on international travel. Note: this records policy for foreign travellers, not citizens
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no restrictions || 1 - screening arrivals || 2 - quarantine arrivals from some or all regions || 3 - ban arrivals from some regions || 4 - ban on all regions or total border closure || Blank - no data

description: Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work. Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no income support || 1 - government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary) || 2 - government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary) || Blank - no data

description: Sectoral scope of: Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work. Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - formal sector workers only || 1 - transfers to informal sector workers too || Blank - no data

description: Record if the government is freezing financial obligations for households (eg stopping loan repayments, preventing services like water from stopping, or banning evictions)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no debt/contract relief || 1 - narrow relief, specific to one kind of contract || 2 - broad debt/contract relief

description: Announced economic stimulus spending. Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  Record monetary value in USD of fiscal stimuli, includes any spending or tax cuts NOT included in E4, H4 or H5 || 0 - no new spending that day || Blank - no data

description: Announced offers of Covid-19 related aid spending to other countries. Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  Record monetary value in USD || 0 - no new spending that day || Blank - no data

description: Record presence of public info campaigns
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no Covid-19 public information campaign || 1 - public officials urging caution about Covid-19 || 2- coordinated public information campaign (eg across traditional and social media) || Blank - no data

description: Geographical scope of: Record presence of public info campaigns
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:   0 - targeted || 1- general || Blank - no data

description: Record government policy on who has access to testing. Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no testing policy || 1 - only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas) || 2 - testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms || 3 - open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people) || Blank - no data

description: Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis. Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  0 - no contact tracing || 1 - limited contact tracing; not done for all cases || 2 - comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

description: Announced short term spending on healthcare system, eg hospitals, masks, etc. Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  Record monetary value in USD || 0 - no new spending that day || Blank - no data

description: Announced public spending on Covid-19 vaccine development. Note: only record amount additional to previously announced spending
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  Record monetary value in USD || 0 - no new spending that day || Blank - no data

description: Record policy announcements that do not fit anywhere else
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: Legend:  Note unusual or interesting interventions that are worth flagging

description: The cumulative total of confirmed Covid-19 cases.
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.

description: The cumulative total of deaths from Covid-19.
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the level of the strictness of 'lockdown style' policies that primarily restrict people's behavior
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the level of the strictness of 'lockdown style' policies that primarily restrict people's behavior (smoothed over the last seven days)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the level of the strictness of 'lockdown style' policies that primarily restrict people's behavior
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: The legacy stringency index approximates the logic of the first version of the Stringency Index, which only had seven components. Use of the legacy index is generally not recommended, unless for continuity purposes. For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the level of the strictness of 'lockdown style' policies that primarily restrict people's behavior (smoothed over the last seven days)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: The legacy stringency index approximates the logic of the first version of the Stringency Index, which only had seven components. Use of the legacy index is generally not recommended, unless for continuity purposes. For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the overall response of government to Covid-19
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect the overall response of government to Covid-20 (smoothed over the last seven days)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect government action related to 'lockdown' restrictions and closures, measures such as testing policy and contract tracing, and short term investment in healthcare and vaccine development
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect government action related to 'lockdown' restrictions and closures, measures such as testing policy and contract tracing, and short term investment in healthcare and vaccine development (smoothed over the last seven days)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect government action related to income support and debt relief
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: A number between 1 and 100 to reflect government action related to income support and debt relief (smoothed over the last seven days)
reference: Hale, T., Webster, S., Petherick, A., Phillips, T., & Kira, B. (2020). Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker. Blavatnik School of Government.
notes: For methodology, see: https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/index_methodology.md

description: Real-time estimate of the effective reproduction rate (R) of Covid-19
reference: Arroyo Marioli, F., Bullano, F., Kucinskas, S., & Rondón-Moreno, C. (2020). Tracking R of COVID-19: A New Real-Time Estimation Using the Kalman Filter (SSRN Scholarly Paper ID 3581633). Social Science Research Network. https://doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.3581633
notes: The average serial interval is set at 7 days which, according to the authors, "yields estimates of the basic reproduction number that are consistent with the current consensus values."
